title: Early Childhood Design Thinking Development: Play-Based Technology Education Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary education methodologies, foundational knowledge of design thinking, and play-based learning theories
context.additional_context: A language pedagogy-linked graduate course exploring play-based educational design to support young children's design thinking development. Learners conduct project-based assessments using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the developmental stages of design thinking in early childhood from a cultural-historical perspective.
Learners can design instructional strategies for design education in play-based environments.
Learners can develop scenarios for early childhood design activities using technological tools and storytelling.
Learners can observe and provide feedback on learners' creative problem-solving processes through project-based assessments.

resources: Early Childhood Design Thinking Development Research Materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
